summary: Game of Thrones, Star Wars and now Endgame proving once and for all that fan theories, fan expectations and fan fiction are the...
body: Game of Thrones, Star Wars and now Endgame proving once and for all that fan theories, fan expectations and fan fiction are the worst thing that can happen to a fandom. The poison these three different fandoms have been spewing bc their fan theories didn’t come true or bc their ships didnt end up together is mindblowing. Ruining the shows and movies for themselves and bumming everyone else out with their constant whining. So freeaking annoying.

blog.name: fuckyeahmortal-instruments
blog.title: Just Random Stuff
blog.description: Hi guys. I'm Angie. 22-year-old girl from Prague, Czech Republic. This site was founded as The Mortal Instrument fansite, but as you can see, it no longer has this purpose.

title: Hypocrisy at its best.
body:
Jaime: Fucks his sister, pushes a 9 year old out of a window, attacks Ned Stark on the streets, he kills his own cousin, he helps wage war against Robb Stark, he fucks his sister in front of his son’s dead body, he tries to kill Daenerys, etc. 

Everyone: “Oh, he is a such a great character, he changed so much, I love him, I forgive him!” 

Melissandre: Gives birth to a shaddow that kills Renly Baratheon, burns people, kidnaps Gendry, burns Shireen Baratheon alive, etc. 

Everyone: “But she brought Jon back, we forgive her!” 

Theon: Betrays Rob, captures Winterfell, burns two kids alive, destroys Sansa’s attempt to run away from Ramsay. 

Everyone: “But he saved Sansa, he is a changed man, he suffered so much, we forgive him!” 


Sansa: Tries to help her father, begs for mercy for her father, is captive in King’s Landing, beaten, tormented, threatened with a crossbow. She tries to kill Joff in episode 10, season 1. She saves a stranger’s life in episode 1, season 2. She survives her torment, not broken. She tells Olenna Tyrell, Joffrey is a monster, so she helps her decide she has to kill him. She runs away, she survives surrounded by monsters, she is sold to the Boltons, brutally raped, beaten, but still not broken. She survives, runs away, accepts Brienne’s trust, reunite with Jon, convince Jon to fight, they take back Winterfell, she saves everyone’s asses, she never takes credit, she let the lords crown Jon King, she stands by him even when she does not agree with him, she cries when Bran comes back, she cries when Arya gets back, she cares for the Northern people, for the food supply, she actually runs the shit, defends Jon in front of the proud Northern lords, while Jon is fucking the dragon queen. She teams up with her siblings, manipulates Littlefinger into a death trap, she passes the sentence, so she kills him, she acknowledges her fathers words about the pack surviving, about the importance of the family. She defends her family and the north when Dany comes, because she doesn’t know her, all she knows is, that her father burned her granddad and uncle alive and that her brother has raped and killed her aunt. She is not afraid to question Dany’s decisions in order to protect the North and her people AND her family, Jon, specifically. She is willing to stay with her people before Arya sends her to the crypts. Yet, terrified, knowing that she is useless when it comes to physical fight, she decides to abandon the hiding spot in order to fight the dead. And she once again, survives. 

Everyone: “Oh gods, she’s such a bitch, she never does anything, just cries how life is unfair, omg, die already, you are useless.”

OK…

summary: my bRIAN HAS TO BE T H A T BITCH
body:
As soon, as s o o n as 8x03 finished, the full blown next day minus my depressed sad red puffy eyes and aching empty heart for Jorah fucking Mormont and every other day which to today is five days so far, and every fucking step I take I am always thinking what’s gonna happen to Jamie and Brienne with death at their door all the time

Like my brain is hitting me with so many facts and lies, cause its my brain of course it’s gonna be a dick to me and make up lies that I’m 80% believing

Like what if Bronn dOES try to kill Jamie and Brienne jumps in front OR THE OTHER WAY AROUND

Or like everything about the fucking incest baby has me shaking a s well

And just

Everything

I just want them to have a good entimate kiss, a good bath sex scene or any sex scene whatever D & D hopefully prefer, or a wedding

But no

my bRIAN HAS TO BE T H A T BITCH

A ping pong OzScot currently living on the Dark Side. Mummy, Tantrum & Meltdown Negotiator & Playdate Social Secretary to my Irish Twins who are my absolute world, Staffie owner, Wifey, TKD, Nerd, HR professional, charity warrior, Governess of Home Duties, Keeper of the Snacks, spoonie, music lover, avid reader, shoe collector, current redhead but blonde at heart, clothes slave and booze hag to Scottish botanical gins/unofficial taster. This is an eclectic collection of thoughts, lyrics and images that tickle my fancy. I do not have copyright to most things I post so please ask me to remove if needs be. I will still be here after 17.12.18. No dick pics or unsolicited sleazy messages as I'm not here to hook up. Occasional #me posts. My bark is probably just as bad as my bite. summary: I’m not sure how I feel about The Long Night. Here are some of my thoughts for really no reason. **Game of Thrones spoilers...
body:
I’m not sure how I feel about The Long Night. Here are some of my thoughts for really no reason.

**Game of Thrones spoilers ahead.

1. To be honest, with everything that was going on I had somewhat forgotten about the whole throne-game and thought that the Battle of Winterfell would have gone for at least 2-3 episodes. I figured this battle was going to be much more grueling and take more up more episodes than the war over a chair…

2. Halfway through the episode I thought this fight is impossible, this is not going to end well, we’ll be lucky if we walk away with five characters left. I thought Sam was about to die, I thought Arya was about to die, Jamie, Clegane,Bran, I was even worried for a second that Dany was about to die (but I should have known better than to think that because she has to try to take the throne, that’s something we’ve been building up to all this time.) 

But in the end, (and I had to look this up, because the whole episode was a game of was-that-a-character-or-an-extra) there were only six character deaths, not including the Night King, and one of them was just Melisandre basically deflating like an Air Dancer.

3. Speaking of something we’ve been building up to all this time, we’ve had seven seasons of this storyline leading up to this great big battle against the Night King and surely, surely he’s not just been killed in an hour… I mean, I’m not really sure how you can come back from being smithereened like that, but I guess time will tell.
body_abstract:
I’m not sure how I feel about The Long Night. Here are some of my thoughts for really no reason.

**Game of Thrones spoilers ahead.

I figured this battle was going to be much more grueling and take more up more episodes than the war over a chair…

2. Halfway through the episode I thought this fight is impossible, this is not going to end well, we’ll be lucky if we walk away with five characters left. I thought Sam was about to die, I thought Arya was about to die, Jamie, Clegane,Bran, I was even worried for a second that Dany was about to die (but I should have known better than to think that because she has to try to take the throne, that’s something we’ve been building up to all this time.) 

But in the end, (and I had to look this up, because the whole episode was a game of was-that-a-character-or-an-extra) there were only six character deaths, not including the Night King, and one of them was just Melisandre basically deflating like an Air Dancer.

3. Speaking of something we’ve been building up to all this time, we’ve had seven seasons of this storyline leading up to this great big battle against the Night King and surely, surely he’s not just been killed in an hour… I mean, I’m not really sure how you can come back from being smithereened like that, but I guess time will tell.

trail.content_raw:
I’m not sure how I feel about The Long Night. Here are some of my thoughts for really no reason.

**Game of Thrones spoilers ahead.

[[MORE]]

1. To be honest, with everything that was going on I had somewhat forgotten about the whole throne-game and thought that the Battle of Winterfell would have gone for at least 2-3 episodes. I figured this battle was going to be much more grueling and take more up more episodes than the war over a chair…

2. Halfway through the episode I thought this fight is impossible, this is not going to end well, we’ll be lucky if we walk away with five characters left. I thought Sam was about to die, I thought Arya was about to die, Jamie, Clegane,Bran, I was even worried for a second that Dany was about to die (but I should have known better than to think that because she has to try to take the throne, that’s something we’ve been building up to all this time.) 

But in the end, (and I had to look this up, because the whole episode was a game of was-that-a-character-or-an-extra) there were only six character deaths, not including the Night King, and one of them was just Melisandre basically deflating like an Air Dancer.

3. Speaking of something we’ve been building up to all this time, we’ve had seven seasons of this storyline leading up to this great big battle against the Night King and surely, surely he’s not just been killed in an hour… I mean, I’m not really sure how you can come back from being smithereened like that, but I guess time will tell.

I’m not sure how I feel about The Long Night. Here are some of my thoughts for really no reason.

**Game of Thrones spoilers ahead.

1. To be honest, with everything that was going on I had somewhat forgotten about the whole throne-game and thought that the Battle of Winterfell would have gone for at least 2-3 episodes. I figured this battle was going to be much more grueling and take more up more episodes than the war over a chair…

2. Halfway through the episode I thought this fight is impossible, this is not going to end well, we’ll be lucky if we walk away with five characters left. I thought Sam was about to die, I thought Arya was about to die, Jamie, Clegane,Bran, I was even worried for a second that Dany was about to die (but I should have known better than to think that because she has to try to take the throne, that’s something we’ve been building up to all this time.) 

But in the end, (and I had to look this up, because the whole episode was a game of was-that-a-character-or-an-extra) there were only six character deaths, not including the Night King, and one of them was just Melisandre basically deflating like an Air Dancer.

summary: How to write a redemption arc - Theon Greyjoy - Game of Thrones | Shadow and movies
title: How to write a redemption arc - Theon Greyjoy - Game of Thrones | Shadow and movies
excerpt: Using the story of Theon Greyjoy from Grame of thrones, here's how to write a redemption arc that will leave readers in tears.
description:
The last season of Game of Thrones was bound to put an end to the suffering of many fans who were waiting to see what faith had in store for their favorite characters.

In episode 3 we finally got a resolution to the longest and (probably) most painful redemption arc in the story: the one of Theon Greyjoy.

[SPOILERS AHEAD]

summary: I love your jaime and brienne boning positivity about tomorrow. I hope you're right :) Im stupidly thinking how amazing if they...
question: I love your jaime and brienne boning positivity about tomorrow. I hope you're right :) Im stupidly thinking how amazing if they have a quick last minute wedding before another potential major battle. For some reason I couldn't imagine her wanting to have sex before being married?
answer: honestly id want them to get married just to see the look on cerseis face when jaime rolls up to kings landing on his heelys and says “FUCK all of yall, im going to tarth”
